author: Freedom (simulated)
suggestion: Skip the commit-reveal phase on CKB and do direct swaps since the cell model + PoW-gated writes already prevent frontrunning. The commit-reveal may be redundant on CKB if the PoW lock script + forced inclusion already eliminate MEV at the infrastructure layer.
jarvis_take: Partially valid. The cell model prevents reentrancy and PoW gating prevents permissionless writes, but miners who solve the PoW can still see pending commit cells before including them. Commit-reveal adds a second layer â€” even the PoW miner can't see order details. However, a lighter commit-reveal (shorter windows, simpler hash) might be possible on CKB since the infrastructure layer handles more of the MEV defense. Worth prototyping both approaches and comparing.
